parametrized_description: A clinic employs nurses and pharmacists to deliver shots to patients. A nurse works NurseShiftHours per shift while a pharmacist works PharmacistShiftHours per shift. Nurses are paid NurseCostPerShift per shift while pharmacists are paid PharmacistCostPerShift per shift. Currently, the clinic needs TotalLaborHours hours of healthcare labor to meet needs. If the firm has a budget of TotalBudget, how many of each healthcare worker should be scheduled to minimize the total number of workers?

NurseShiftHours.description: Number of hours a nurse works per shift

PharmacistShiftHours.description: Number of hours a pharmacist works per shift

NurseCostPerShift.description: Cost to employ one nurse per shift

PharmacistCostPerShift.description: Cost to employ one pharmacist per shift

constraints.description: The total healthcare labor hours provided by nurses and pharmacists must be at least TotalLaborHours.
The total labor cost for nurses and pharmacists must not exceed TotalBudget.

objective.description: Minimize the total number of workers, which is the sum of nurses and pharmacists, while meeting the required healthcare labor hours and adhering to the budget.
